verses.roman:
gopāla-saundarya duṅhāra mana nila hari'
sukha pāñā rahe tāhāṅ dina dui-cāri

synonyms: gopāla-saundarya—the beauty of the Gopāla Deity; duṅhāra—of both of them; mana—the minds; nila—took away; hari'-carrying; sukha pāñā—feeling this transcendental happiness; rahe—remained; tāhāṅ—in that temple; dina—days; dui-cāri—two or four.
translation: The beauty of the Gopāla Deity stole away their minds, and feeling great happiness, they remained there for two or four days.
